name.japanese: エドワード・ニューゲート

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Confronts Blackbeard
keyMoments.description: Despite his mortal wounds, Whitebeard faces Blackbeard to settle the score for Ace and Thatch's deaths.
keyMoments.significance: Whitebeard's final battle showcasing his unwavering determination even in death.
keyMoments.quote: Teach... You're the only one I won't call my son!

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard's Bisento Strike
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard delivers a devastating bisento slash to Blackbeard despite his Devil Fruit powers being nullified.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that Whitebeard's strength transcends his Devil Fruit powers.
keyMoments.quote: You're a hundred years too early to kill me, Teach!

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Declares The One Piece Is Real
keyMoments.description: With his dying breath, Whitebeard confirms to the world that the One Piece truly exists.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most pivotal moments in the series, reigniting the Great Pirate Era.
keyMoments.quote: The One Piece... The One Piece is real!

keyMoments.title: The Death of Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Edward Newgate dies standing on his feet with 267 sword wounds, 152 gunshot wounds, and 46 cannonball wounds, but not a single scar on his back.
keyMoments.significance: The death of one of the Four Emperors marks a major turning point in world power.
keyMoments.quote: Thank you for loving me... this good-for-nothing father of yours.

relationships.description: Whitebeard confronts Blackbeard for betraying the crew and killing Thatch and Ace.

evolutionMoments.description: Whitebeard declares Teach is the only one he won't call his son, rejecting him completely.

relationships.description: Flashback reveals Whitebeard's memories of conversations with Roger about the One Piece and the Will of D.

evolutionMoments.description: Whitebeard recalls his relationship with Roger in his final moments.

reveals.information: Whitebeard dies with 465 total battle wounds but no scars on his back, symbolizing he never fled from battle
Whitebeard knows about the One Piece and prophesies a great war when it is found
Whitebeard completely rejects Blackbeard as his son due to his betrayal

name.japanese: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

keyMoments.title: Blackbeard Faces Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard confronts his former captain in a climactic battle.
keyMoments.significance: The culmination of Blackbeard's betrayal and his path to power.
keyMoments.quote: Your earthquake powers are useless against my darkness!

keyMoments.title: Blackbeard Nullifies Whitebeard's Powers
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard demonstrates his Yami Yami no Mi's ability to nullify other Devil Fruit powers.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the unique strategic advantage of the Yami Yami no Mi.
keyMoments.quote: Your earthquake powers are useless against my darkness!

keyMoments.title: Rejected by Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard declares that Blackbeard is not the one Roger was waiting for.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Blackbeard as a dark counterpart to the inherited will theme.

abilities.description: Blackbeard uses his darkness to nullify Whitebeard's Gura Gura no Mi powers by touching him.

relationships.description: Blackbeard battles his former captain, ultimately contributing to his death.

evolutionMoments.description: Blackbeard and his crew brutally attack the dying Whitebeard.

reveals.information: Demonstrates the full capability of Yami Yami no Mi to nullify other Devil Fruit powers in combat

keyMoments.title: Marco Mourns Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Marco and the Whitebeard Pirates break down in tears witnessing their captain's death.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the deep familial bond between Whitebeard and his crew.

relationships.description: Marco grieves the loss of his captain and father figure.

evolutionMoments.description: Marco witnesses Whitebeard's death and mourns with the crew.
